quote-text: The baby has known the dragon intimately ever since he had an imagination. What the fairy tale provides for him is a St. George to kill the dragon.
quote-source:
G. K. Chesterton

Or as Neil Gaiman so expertly summarized it, âFairytales donât tell children that dragons exist. Children already know that dragons exist.Â  Fairytales tell children that dragons can be killed.â

(via aintnoshakespeare)

(Posted for those who wonder what Chesterton said, and what I said (and then confused everyone by attributing to him)
